short_summary: Procurement for construction of office space for future embassy in Managua, Nicaragua
description: This project entails the construction of fit-up space for an office space for a future embassy located in Managua, Nicaragua. The contractor selected will be responsible for completion of this project.

full_summary:
================
### Tender Announcement: Relocation of the Embassy of Canada to Nicaragua

#### Procurement Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: cb-193-95396960
* **Solicitation Number**: 24-253693
* **Publication Date**: November 28, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: December 15, 2023, 2:00 PM Eastern Time

#### Procurement Overview

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is issuing a tender for the construction Fit-Up of an Office Space for a future Embassy of Canada located in Managua, Nicaragua. The procurement will be conducted through an open bidding process.

#### Submission Requirements

To submit a bid, please visit the [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/) website and access the tender documentation using the following links:

* English: [Link 1](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/26134/l-mngua-100-eng.pdf) or [Link 2](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/26134/l-mngua-100-eng_0.pdf)
* French: [Link 1](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/26134/l-mngua-100-fr_0.pdf) or [Link 2](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/26134/l-mngua-100-fr.pdf)

#### Contact Information

For any tender related inquiries, please contact Meghan Tchorznickis, Real Property - Contracts, at:

* Email: <realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca>
* Phone: (613) 290-7847

#### Tender Schedule

* **Expected Contract Start Date**: Not specified
* **Expected Contract End Date**: Not specified

#### Important Notes

Please note that the tender is subject to the applicable trade agreements, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The procurement will be conducted in accordance with the World Trade Organization's (WTO) rules and regulations. Additionally, the contract will be governed by the laws of Canada.
